author: paulhauner

author: paulhauner
content: What are peoples thoughts on changing `GENESIS_DELAY` so we can start the net today instead of friday night/saturday morning?

author: ajsutton
content: If anything I'd probably increase the delay so it happens next week.  Otherwise EU/US get very little notice of the change.  But also I think we need to run a test of genesis where the minimum validators is reached before minimum time.

author: paulhauner
content: Both points make sense to me. We could achieve both by increasing the validator count at the same time.

author: paulhauner
content: I'm not sure if that's too much complexity, though.

author: ajsutton
content: The other option is that we all just agree to leave it unsupervised this weekend and not announce it until next week if it works or to silently restart if not. üôÇ

author: paulhauner
content: That also works. My preference is for some action that moves the launch away from the weekend. Long term goal is to launch Eth2 without burning-out core devs.

author: paulhauner
content: If the consensus is to let it happen on the weekend, then I can deal with that too. It's not mission-critical so I won't be asking any of our team to give up their Saturday at short notice. I'll still be around to watch over it though, I was partly responsible for the delayed start.

author: ajsutton
content: Maybe one more genesis delay change to go to the standard T+2 finance model (+2 workdays).  Public holidays are a real pain though.

author: djrtwo
content:
> What about MIN_GENESIS_TIME of 1593432000?

are you suggesting that plus the original 48 hour delay?

author: djrtwo
content: Note, by changing this constant, this will allow more deposits to be included in the genesis state (not a bad thing just a note)

author: donschoe
content: Ok, the delay is added to the min genesis time even though we have sufficient amount of deposits?

author: donschoe
content: What's the reasoning for that?

author: donschoe
content: I was under the assumption that the delay happens between the deposits and the genesis time and the min genesis time is just an additional boundary

author: djrtwo
content:
min_genesis_time is a misnomer at this point. It is minimum eth1 block timestamp that will be considered for generating the genesis state.

there is always an offset from the actual time that the first eth1 block satisfies the min_genesis_time and min deposits. This offset allows for (1) handling the follow distance safely and (2) allowing for manual intervention if needed

What we currently have (with the current min_genesis_time/min_deposits config) is some time ~9 hours ago. With `GENESIS_DELAY` tuning, we can configure whatever time we want from that point

author: djrtwo
content: Or we can push back `MIN_GENESIS_TIME` which would allow for potentially more deposits between now and then. Then once the time is hit, `GENESIS_DELAY` will still be applied

author: donschoe
content: Ok

author: djrtwo
content:
So we can set min_genesis_time to be on saturday, leave the delay the same, and have genesis on monday

or we can work with the current min_genesis_time param (and when deposits were acutally hit) and add the offset to pick a very specific time

author: djrtwo
content: How about min_genesis_time as saturday at 12:30pm UTC. That would put the actually genesis time (with a 48 hour offset) at monday 12:30pm UTC. A bit early for the US, good for europe, a bit late for australia (but not quite as late as the eth2 calls)

author: terence0083
content: Sounds good to me. More coffee for the west coast people
